longDef.en: an occasion when someone appears in public

examples.en: It was his first appearance on television/television appearance as president.
examples.cn: 这是他就任总统以来首次在电视上亮相。

examples.en: She will be making a public appearance, signing copies of her latest novel.
examples.cn: 她将公开亮相，为自己刚刚出版的小说签名售书。

longDef.en: an occasion when someone goes to court to be officially involved in a trial

examples.en: This was the defendant's third court appearance for the same offence.
examples.cn: 这是被告因为同一桩罪行第三次出庭受审。

longDef.en: a public performance by an entertainer

examples.en: He made his first stage/TV appearance at the age of six.
examples.cn: 在6岁时他首次登台演出／在电视上亮相。

longDef.en: to be present somewhere for a short time:
longDef.cn: 我真不想参加这个聚会，但是我想还是露个面的好。

examples.en: I didn't really want to go to the party, but I thought I'd better put in an appearance.
examples.cn: 我真不想参加这个聚会，但是我想还是露个面的好。

longDef.en: the way a person or thing looks to other people

examples.en: a middle-aged man of smart appearance
examples.cn: 一个外表整洁的中年男子

examples.en: You can alter/change the whole appearance of a room just by lighting it in a certain way.
examples.cn: 只要在灯光上做些文章，整个房间面貌就会焕然一新。

examples.en: There was nothing unusual about/in her physical appearance.
examples.cn: 她的外表并没有什么特别之处。

examples.en: The large car outside the house gave the appearance of wealth (= suggested wealthy people lived there).
examples.cn: 住宅外面停的那辆大轿车显示出主人很富有。

longDef.en: what things look like or seem to be rather than what they actually are:
longDef.cn: 他这个人实际上很难懂，与其外表相去甚远。

examples.en: He was a far more complicated man than outward appearances suggested.
examples.cn: 他这个人实际上很难懂，与其外表相去甚远。

longDef.en: judging from what can be seen:
longDef.cn: 从表面看他们的婚姻很美满，但我觉得在私下里她不会给他好日子过。

examples.en: To all appearances their marriage is fine, but I think she gives him a bad time in private.
examples.cn: 从表面看他们的婚姻很美满，但我觉得在私下里她不会给他好日子过。
